[File: aptos-core/network/netcore/src/transport/boxed.rs] [Type: Listener] [Type confusion] Can a malicious actor exploit the Listener type alias being a pinned boxed stream to inject crafted stream items that bypass peer verification, potentially allowing unauthorized validators to participate in consensus? [File: aptos-core/network/netcore/src/transport/boxed.rs] [Type: Inbound] [Memory safety] Does the Inbound pinned future properly handle panics during connection establishment, or could a panic in the boxed future lead to memory corruption affecting validator state and causing consensus failure? (High)

[File: aptos-core/network/netcore/src/transport/boxed.rs] [Type: Outbound] [Resource exhaustion] Can an attacker create unbounded Outbound futures through repeated dial attempts, exhausting memory on validator nodes and causing loss of liveness in the network? (High)

[File: aptos-core/network/netcore/src/transport/boxed.rs] [Type: Listener] [Stream safety] Does the boxed stream implementation properly enforce backpressure, or can a flood of incoming connections overwhelm the listener causing validator nodes to crash and affecting network availability? (High)
